Description: Green glazed composition amuletic figure in the hybrid form of a winged dwarf standing on a rectangular base, with ram head topped by a sun-disc, and a suspension ring (broken away) on the back.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 2 or 3
Curator's comments: "Of glazed ware", "a combination of Ptah-Sokar, Khnum, and hawk", mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 72, p. 111, pl. xli, 70.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 72, p. 111, pl. xli, 70)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.45, p.62, p.180, pl.22)
